com.illcode.meterman.impl

Class WorldBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.illcode.meterman.impl.WorldBuilder

  • public class WorldBuilder
extends Object
    A class with utility methods to assist generating the initial world state of a game, using the BaseEntity and BaseRoom implementations.

    If you use the "mass effect" methods to load your rooms and entities, the order of calls with usually be

    1. loadRooms(String)
    2. loadEntities(String)
    3. loadRoomConnections(String)
    4. loadEntityPlacements(String)
    5. loadPlayerState(String)
    In this case, only delegates and managers will need to be manually wired together in a Game's getInitialWorldState() method.

      • loadEntity

        public BaseEntity loadEntity(String passageName)

      • readEntityDataFromBundle

        public JsonObject readEntityDataFromBundle(BaseEntity e,
                                  String passageName)
        Loads an entity from a bundle passage that contains JSON data in the format of this example: 
        {
            "id" : "ferryman",
            "name" : "River Ferryman",
            "indefiniteArticle" : "a",
            "listName" : "Ferryman",
            "description" : "[[ferryman-description]]",
            "imageName" : "ferryman",
            "attributes" : ["concealed", "lightsource"],
        }
        indefiniteArticle is optional. listName is optional, and if not present, the value of name will be used.
        attributes is optional.
        Parameters:
        e - BaseEntity into which to store the data
        passageName - name of the bundle passage
        Returns:
        the JsonObject parsed from passageName
        See Also:
        Attributes.stringToEntityAttribute(java.lang.String)

      • loadTalkingEntity

        Returns:

      • readTalkingEntityDataFromBundle

        public JsonObject readTalkingEntityDataFromBundle(TalkingEntity te,
                                         String passageName)
        Loads a talking entity from a bundle passage that contains JSON data in the format of this example: 
        {
        "id" : "underground-hermit",
        "name" : "Bearded Hermit",
        "listName" : "Hermit",
        "description" : "[[underground-hermit-description]]",
        "imageName" : "underground-hermit",
        "dialogText" : "The hermit waits for you to say something.",
        "noTopicsText" : "The hermit has nothing to say to you.",
        "topicMap" : "underground-hermit-topics",
        "currentTopics" : ["hello"]
    }
        Parameters:
        te - TalkingEntity into which to store the data
        passageName - name of the bundle passage
        Returns:
        the JsonObject parsed from passageName

      • loadTopicMap

        public Map<String,TalkTopic> loadTopicMap(String passageName)
        Loads a "topic map" (i.e. a mapping from topic ID to TalkTopic instance) from JSON data in the bundle. The format of the topic map JSON data is as in this example: 
        {
            "hello" : {
                "label" : "Hello",
                "text" : "Hello stranger.",
                "addTopics" : ["underground", "monster"]
            },
            "underground" : {
                "label" : "What's this underground?",
                "text" : "The underground area is my refuge from the corrupt world.",
                "addTopics" : ["name"],
                "removeTopics" : ["hello", "underground"]
            },
            "name" : {
                "label" : "What's your name?",
                "text" : "My name is Superfly Hermit!",
                "removeTopics" : ["name"]
            },
            "monster" : {
                "label" : "Monster in the Dark",
                "text" : "[[monster-in-dark-text]]"
            }
        }
        Parameters:
        passageName - name of the passage under which the JSON data is to be found
        Returns:
        topic map

      • loadDoor

        public Door loadDoor(String passageName)
        Load and return a Door from JSON data in the bundle
        Parameters:
        passageName - name of the passage under which the JSON data is to be found
        Returns:
        loaded Door

      • readDoorDataFromBundle

        public JsonObject readDoorDataFromBundle(Door d,
                                String passageName)
        Loads a door from a bundle passage that contains JSON data in the format of this example: 
        {
            "id" : "id",
            "name" : "name",
            "listName" : "listName",
            "imageName" : "imageName",
            "descriptions" : [
                "Description as seen from room #1",
                "Description as seen from room #2"
            ],
            "lockedMessages" : [
                "Additional description shown from room #1 when the door is locked",
                "Additional description shown from room #2 when the door is locked"
            ],
            "unlockedMessages" : [
                "Additional description shown from room #1 when the door is closed but unlocked",
                "Additional description shown from room #2 when the door is closed but unlocked"
            ],
            "openMessages" : [
                "Additional description shown from room #1 when the door is open.",
                "Additional description shown from room #2 when the door is open."
            ],
            "noKeyMessages" : [
                "Message displayed when the player attempts to unlock the door from room #1 without the key",
                "Message displayed when the player attempts to unlock the door from room #2 without the key"
            ]
        }
        For each of the above arrays, you can have only one string item, in which case it will be used for both rooms. If the entry is missing completely, a default string from the system bundle will be used.
        Parameters:
        d - Door into which to store the data
        passageName - name of the bundle passage
        Returns:
        the JsonObject parsed from passageName

        public BaseRoom loadRoom(String passageName)

        Parameters:

      • readRoomDataFromBundle

        public JsonObject readRoomDataFromBundle(BaseRoom r,
                                String passageName)
        Loads a room from a bundle passage that contains JSON data in the format of this example: 
        {
           "id" : "river-edge",
           "name" : "River's Edge",
           "exitName" : "River Edge",
           "description" : "Here the woods give way to the bank of the River Jelly.",
           "attributes" : ["dark", "visited"]
       }
        exitName is optional, and if not present the value of name will be used.
        attributes is optional.
        Parameters:
        r - BaseRoom into which to store the data
        passageName - name of the bundle passage
        Returns:
        the JsonObject parsed from passageName
        See Also:
        Attributes.stringToRoomAttribute(java.lang.String)

      • readDarkRoomDataFromBundle

        public JsonObject readDarkRoomDataFromBundle(DarkRoom dr,
                                    String passageName)
        Loads a dark room from a bundle passage that contains JSON data in the format of this example: 
        {
            "id" : "dark-passage1",
            "name" : "Dark Passage",
            "exitName" : "Dark Passage",
            "description" : "A stony underground passage."
            "darkName" : "Dark Underground Passage",
            "darkExitName" : "Darkness",
            "darkDescription" : "The air is still and slightly acrid in this dark passage.",
            "attributes" : ["dark"]
        }
        Parameters:
        dr - DarkRoom into which to store the data
        passageName - name of the bundle passage
        Returns:
        the JsonObject parsed from passageName

        label1 - the exit label to use in the first room
        roomId2 - id of the second room
        pos2 - the exit position in the second room to connect to the first room
        label2 - the exit label to use in the second room

      • connectRoomsWithDoor

        public void connectRoomsWithDoor(String doorId,
                        String roomId1,
                        int pos1,
                        String roomId2,
                        int pos2,
                        String keyId,
                        boolean locked,
                        boolean open)
        Connect two rooms with a door between them.
        Parameters:
        doorId - id of the Door entity
        roomId1 - id of the first room
        pos1 - the exit position in the first room to connect to the second room
        roomId2 - id of the second room
        pos2 - the exit position in the second room to connect to the first room
        keyId - the id of the key entity, or null for no key
        locked - whether the door should be locked (set first)
        open - whether the door should be open (set second, can override locked)

      • putEntitiesInRoom

        public void putEntitiesInRoom(String roomId,
                     String... entityIds)
        Put multiple entities into a room.
        Parameters:
        roomId - id of the room
        entityIds - IDs of the entities to put in the room

      • loadRooms

        public void loadRooms(String passageName)
        Loads rooms listed in a JSON definition in a bundle passage. A definition entry looks like this: 
        [
      passageName1, passageName2, ...
   ]
        (you need to format the JSON array in this way because if it's on one line it will be treated as a bundle passage name)

        Certain suffixes may be attacked to a passage name for special treatment:

        • Suffix :dark - loaded as a DarkRoom
        For each passage name listed, we will call the appropriate variant of loadRoom(String).
        Parameters:
        passageName - name of the passage under which the JSON definition is to be found

      • loadEntities

        public void loadEntities(String passageName)
        Loads entities listed in a JSON definition in a bundle passage. A definition entry looks like this: 
        [
      passageName1, passageName2, ...
   ]
        (you need to format the JSON array in this way because if it's on one line it will be treated as a bundle passage name)

        Certain suffixes may be attacked to a passage name for special treatment:

        • Suffix :door - loaded as a Door
        • Suffix :talking - loaded as a TalkingEntity
        For each passage name listed, we will call the appropriate variant of loadEntity(String).
        Parameters:
        passageName - name of the passage under which the JSON definition is to be found

      • loadEntityPlacements

        public void loadEntityPlacements(String passageName)
        Places entities into rooms based on a JSON definition given in a passage bundle. A definition entry looks like this: 
        [
     [roomId1, entityId1, entityId2, ...],
     [roomId2, entityId1, entityId2, ...],
     ...
 ]
        All rooms and entities referenced must already have been loaded prior to calling this method.
        Parameters:
        passageName -

      • loadRoomConnections

        public void loadRoomConnections(String passageName)
        Loads a room-connection defintion from JSON in a bundle passage, and connects the rooms given in the defintion. A defintion entry looks like this: 
        [
    [roomId1, pos1, roomId2, pos2],
    [roomId1, pos1, roomId2],
    [doorId, roomId1, pos1, roomId2, pos2, keyId, locked, open],
    ...
 ]
        The different lengths of arrays correspond to connectRooms(String, int, String, int), connectRoomOneWay(String, int, String), and connectRoomsWithDoor(String, String, int, String, int, String, boolean, boolean), respectively.

        The "pos" parameters take one of these string values:

        "NW", "N", "NE", "X1",
        "W", "MID", "E", "X2",
        "SW", "S", "SE", "X3"
        No real input validation is performed, so write your JSON correctly!

        All rooms referenced in the connection list must have already been loaded prior to calling this method.

        Parameters:
        passageName - name of the passage under which the JSON definition is to be found

      • loadPlayerState

        public void loadPlayerState(String passageName)
        Loads the initial player room and inventory list from a JSON definition given in a bundle passage. The definition looks like this: 
        {
     "currentRoom" : roomId,
     "inventory" : [entityId1, entityId2, ...],
     "worn" : [entityId1, entityId2, ...],
     "equipped" : [entityId1, entityId2, ...]
 }
        currentRoom is mandatory, the rest are optional.
        Parameters:
        passageName - name of the passage under which the JSON definition is to be found

      • retrieveTextOrDefault

        protected String retrieveTextOrDefault(JsonObject o,
                           String name,
                           String defaultPassageName)
        Retrieves text from a JsonObject by attempting to read the value associated with a given name; if the JsonObject has no member under the given name, a default passage will be read from the bundle and returned.
        Parameters:
        o - JsonObject
        name - name of the JsonObject member whose value to read
        defaultPassageName - the passage returned if o has no member with the given name.
        Returns:
        text from o or the default passage text

      • retrieveMultiTextOrDefault

        protected void retrieveMultiTextOrDefault(JsonObject o,
                              String name,
                              int numStrings,
                              String defaultPassageName)
        Attempt to retrieve multiple strings from a JsonObject by reading the items of an array member. The strings are stored in the retrievedMultiStrings field of WorldBuilder, to avoid allocation on each call.

        If the object member is not an array, the retrieved strings will all be the text stored in the bundle under defaultPassageName.

        If the object member is an array, there are three possibilities:

        1. The array size is 0. In this case, all retrieved strings will be the empty string.
        2. The array size is less than numStrings. In this case the value of the first array item will be used for all retrieved strings.
        3. The array size is >= numStrings. In this case the retrieved strings are taken from the respectively indexed item of the array.
        Parameters:
        o - JsonObject
        name - name of the JsonObject member whose value to read as an array
        numStrings - the number of strings to attempt to retrieve from the array and store in retrievedMultiStrings
        defaultPassageName - the passage whose text to use if o has no member under name, or if the value is not an array.

      • getJsonString

        protected String getJsonString(JsonValue v)
        If v is a normal JSON string, return its String value; if v is a string of the form "[[passage-name]]" use it as a passage name in the text bundle. Otherwise return the empty string.

      • getJsonString

        protected String getJsonString(JsonValue v,
                   String defaultString)
        If v is a normal JSON string, return its String value; if v is a string of the form "[[passage-name]]" use it as a passage name in the text bundle. Otherwise return defaultString.

      • jsonValueAsString

        protected String jsonValueAsString(JsonValue v,
                       String defaultString)
        If v is a string, return its value; otherwise return defaultString.
